result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J Clemetson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Peter J Clemetson was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter J Clemetson is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Peter J Clemetson was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Peter J Clemetson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Peter J Clemetson with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf. 4:32 Case called  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
14CF339, & 13CM422

Sentencing on 14CF339, counts 2  & 3
NC plea to count 2 & 3 in 15CF127, defer count 3
90 days jail on each count concurrent, $1294.06 Restitution plus surcharges on 15CF127
$443.00 costs on each count
Dismiss 13CM422


Dismiss all remaining counts
Waive prelim on 15CF127 and waive filing of information

Defendant pleads No contest to Count 2 & 3 in 15CF127

Court finds rights waived voluntarily, parties stipulate to suficient factual basis
defers acceptance of plea on count 3 in 15CF127
Finds defendant guilty to count 2 in 15CF127
counts 1  & 4 dismissed
13CM422 dismissed
State - victim rights complied with
Court - follows joint recommendation
14CF339  count 2, 90 days jail, huber allowed, $243.00 cc, $200.00 DNA surcharge
Count 3, 90 days jail concurrent w/count 2, $243.00 cc, $200.00 DNA surcharge
15CF127 count 2, 90 days jail concurrent w/14CF339, $243.00 cc, $200.00 DNA surcharge, submit DNA sample
No jail credit, defendant to report to jail by 1/30/16 5:00 pm
Count 3 in 15CF127 defered  Review hearing scheduled for November 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.
#2 evidence envelope w/silver round tin (placed on shelf in clerk of courts)
Defendant's
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Random List Report - Case
Ct, 2 - Guilty
Ct. 1 - Not Guilty

Defendant, Peter J Clemetson with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  8:34 am

Case called.  Pre trial conference outside of jury.  State has filed motion in limine re: prior convictions.  Argument.  COURT:  will allow only most recent conviction.   Argument re: other motions.  No obj to sequestration.  Parties argue Sgt. Kurtzhalls testimony.
COURT:  will not allow any reference to heresay evidence.  Defense motion - #1 granted.  Defense is willing to stipulate to elements of ct 3.  COURT:  believes state must accept stipulation. Advises def that if found guilty of ct 1 or 2, he would be found guilty of ct 3 due to stipulating to the elements. Finds waiver by defendant voluntary. Exhibits not going to jury will be marked w/letters. 
 Ex. A - JOC 00CF145, Ex. B - Amended JOC 00CF145 - both exhibits made part of the record but will not go to jury.    9:11 - short recess.  
9:18 am - Jury enters.  Case called.  Panel sworn.  20 jurors drawn.  9:26 - Voir dire by Court.  9:44 am - voir dire by State.  9:52 - Voir dire by Rivard.  10:05 am - State moves to strike #15.  Rivard argues.  Court will not strike #15 for cause.  10:06 - Strikes taken.  Court introduces staff.  10:16 - 12 jurors selected.  Panel Sworn.  10:19 - Jurors excused.  Ex. 1, Driving Record, marked. Recess to 10:40 am  10:44 - Jury enters.  On record.  Court reads preliminary instructions.  10:50 am - State gives opening statement.  10:52 - Atty. Rivard gives opening statement.  
11:00 am - State calls Sgt Todd Kurtzhalls.  Sworn & testifies.  Rivard raises objection to defendants added comments during testimony.  Jury excused.  COURT:  advises witness to only answer the questions put to thim.  Rivard makes record - moves for mistrial.  State argues.  COURT:  denies motion for mistrial.  Will instruct jury to disregard comments.  11:17 am - Jury enters.  Direct exam continues.  Ex. #2 - Evidence Envelope.    Ex. #3 - Inventory record, off'd & rec'd. 11:28 - Cross exam.  11:51 - Redirect. 11:53 am - recross.  11:54 am - excused.  Jury excused to 1:20 pm.  1: 23 pm - Jury enters.  State calls Sgt. Marshall Multhauf.  Sworn & testifies.  Ex. #4 - Evidence Release form, off'd & rec'd. 1:34 - cross examEx. #2A - Small tin w/red evidence tape. 1:37 pm - redirect 1:39 pm - recross. 1:41 excused.  State calls Kenneth Olson.  Sworn & testifies.  Ex. #6 - Lab receipt, off'd. Rivard objects.  Ct - rec's #6.  Ex. #5 - Copy of Lab Report, off'd. 1:57 - Cross exam.  Ex. #7 - Tests, off'd & rec'd.  Ex. #5, rec'd. 2:15 pm - redirect.  Re cross.  2:19 pm - excused.  Ex. 2 and 2A - off'd and rec'd. 2:22 pm - Jury excused.  State asks that court allow tin be published to the jury.  Court agrees.  2:25 pm - recess.  2:41 - Juors enter.  Ex. #1 - Driving record, off'd & rec'd.  State recalls Sgt. Kurtzhalls.  No cross.  Excused.  State rests.  Jury excused.  Rivard moves for directed verdict.  Renews motion for mistrial.  State argues. COURT:  Denies motion for directed verdict.  Denies motion for mistrial.  Defendant will testify.  COURT:  questions defendant.  Finds waiver voluntary.  3:01 pm - Defense calls Peter Clemetson. Sworn & testifies.  3:12 pm - cross exam. 3:16 pm - redirect. 3:17 - excused.  Bench conference.  State recalls Sgt. Kurtzhalls. 3:21 pm - cross exam. 3:23 - redirect.  Recross.  Excused.  Jury excused.  3:26 - Jury instruction conference.  3:50 pm Jury Enters.  Court reads instructions. 4:10 - State gives closing argument.  4:18 Rivard argues.  4:30 pm - Rebuttal by State. 4:35 - Court continues instructions.  4:39 - Bailiffs sworn.  Jury excused.   Recess.  5:51 pm  Jury enters with verdict:

Count 1 - NOT GUILTY
Count 2 - GUILTY - OAR
Court polls jury.   5:56 - Jurors excused.

COURT:  enters judgment of acquital Ct. 1
enters judgment of guilty - Ct. 2
Finds def guilty - ct 3 - per stipulation.  

Bond to continue to sentencing  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
